definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: His list ultimately became church policy.
sentences.chinese: 他所开列的书目最终成为了教会的政策。

sentences.english: Police inventoried the diamonds and confirmed Austein's identity.
sentences.chinese: 警方将钻石开列清单登录，并确认奥斯坦的身分。

sentences.english: Will you please quote your rate for the cover?
Every morning, she made out a list of fashion magazines and make-ups.
sentences.chinese: 每天早上，她开列一个时尚杂志和化妆品的清单。

sentences.english: Below is a list of books recently received.
sentences.chinese: 兹将新到书籍开列如下。

sentences.english: Some of the properties of cathode rays listed below.
sentences.chinese: 现将阴极射线的一些特性开列如下。

sentences.english: Our best offer is given below, subjet to our final confirmation.
sentences.chinese: 我方最低价盘开列如下，以我方最后确认为准。

sentences.english: It is the centralized, up-to date reference for rendering of accounts.
sentences.chinese: 它是开列账目的集中的，最新的参考。

sentences.english: A list with or without directed focus is largely determined by how much list-makers understand the readers.
sentences.chinese: 是否有针对性决定于书目开列者对阅读者的了解程度。

sentences.english: Mother compiled a list of the groceries we needed.
sentences.chinese: 母亲开列了一张我们所需物品的购物单。

definition: to lay out (an argument) item by item/memorandum to a superior
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
to reach an agreement/to agree upon
variant of 按語|按语[an4 yu3]
